Many of such molecules may be potentially found in essential oils (EOs). These aromatic oily liquids are derived from such materials of natural origin as flowers, buds, seeds, leaves, twigs, bark, herbs, wood, fruits and roots. There is plenty of evidence of EOs antimicrobial activity already
